author: domenico
post: According Atanasius, Pope Sylvester I (314/335) ordinated that the Sacrifice should be offered not on a silk or colored cloth but only on a white linen cloth. “Constitutio sancti Silvestri papae statuit ut sacrificium altaris non in serico, neque in panno tincto celebretur, nisi tantum in lineo terreno procreato, sicut corpus domini nostri Jhesu Christi in syndone munda sepultum est”. In 382 St. Optatus Bishop of Milevis in Numidia (4th century) presupposes that their use is universally known, exclaiming: “Who among the faithful are ignorant of the fact that in the celebration of the Divine Mystery the wooden altar is covered with a linen cloth ?”...
title: More on the Tablecloth of Turin: Linen Cloth Used for the Eucharist (Communion/Mass)
